meanings.definition: A small adhesive piece of paper used to send mail
meanings.sent1: I put a stamp on the letter before mailing it.
meanings.sent2: The stamp on the envelope showed a picture of a flower.
meanings.sent3: The stamp on the package made it look official.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of stamps was like a colorful mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The stamp with the airplane made me dream of traveling.

meanings.definition: To bring down (one's foot) heavily on the ground or a particular object
meanings.sent1: He stamps his feet when he's angry.
meanings.sent2: The dancer stamps her feet to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent3: The toddler stamps his feet in a tantrum.
meanings.sent4: The hammer stamps the nail firmly into the wood.
meanings.sent5: The elephant stamps the ground with its massive foot.

meanings.sent1: Her kindness is her most remarkable stamp.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work bears his unique stamp.
meanings.sent3: His sense of humor is his personal stamp on everything.
meanings.sent4: The old house had the stamp of elegance in every detail.
meanings.sent5: The stamp of excellence was evident in her performance.

meanings.definition: To impress a pattern or mark onto a surface
meanings.sent1: She stamps the design onto the fabric with ink.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith stamps his initials on the metalwork.
meanings.sent3: The baker stamps the logo on each loaf of bread.
meanings.sent4: The potter stamps a unique symbol on each piece.
meanings.sent5: The artist stamps her signature on the painting.

meanings.definition: To mark with a postage stamp
meanings.sent1: He stamps the letter with the official seal.
meanings.sent2: She carefully stamps each envelope with the postage mark.
meanings.sent3: The clerk stamps the package with the date.
meanings.sent4: The post office stamps the parcel with the tracking number.
meanings.sent5: The collector stamps the rare stamp with caution.
